meanings.definition: Remove the frock or vestments from (a priest)
meanings.sent1: The bishop decided to defrock the priest for his misconduct.
meanings.sent2: It is a serious matter to defrock a clergy member in the church.
meanings.sent3: The church picnic turned chaotic when the priest accidentally defrocked himself.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to defrock the trees of their colorful leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The tailor carefully defrocked the mannequin before fitting a new outfit.

meanings.definition: Deprive (someone) of a position or privilege
meanings.sent1: The company had to defrock the CEO due to financial irregularities.
meanings.sent2: It is never easy to defrock someone of their authority.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous students plotted to defrock the principal of his parking spot.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in policy seemed to defrock the employees of their job security.
meanings.sent5: The king's decision to defrock the knight shocked the entire kingdom.
